channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
It fails in the daily ci.

https://dev.azure.com/apache-flink/apache-flink/_build/results?buildId=69874&view=logs&j=5c8e7682-d68f-54d1-16a2-a09310218a49&t=9d734c8c-6253-55e6-3bce-47e7cdf68ac4

A dig the log and see the cause, hope this helps:

Caused by: java.util.concurrent.CompletionException: java.util.concurrent.CompletionException: org.apache.flink.runtime.jobmanager.scheduler.NoResourceAvailableException: Could not acquire the minimum required resources.
	at org.apache.flink.runtime.scheduler.DefaultExecutionDeployer.lambda$assignResource$4(DefaultExecutionDeployer.java:226)
	... 40 more
Caused by: java.util.concurrent.CompletionException: org.apache.flink.runtime.jobmanager.scheduler.NoResourceAvailableException: Could not acquire the minimum required resources.
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture.encodeThrowable(CompletableFuture.java:332)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture.completeThrowable(CompletableFuture.java:347)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$UniApply.tryFire(CompletableFuture.java:636)
	... 38 more
Caused by: org.apache.flink.runtime.jobmanager.scheduler.NoResourceAvailableException: Could not acquire the minimum required resources.

Besides, I found a suspicious TM lost:

 Sink: sink (3/5)#3 (f9992f7a28b35a6b3d973841daf88aa2_2e588ce1c86a9d46e2e85186773ce4fd_2_3) switched from RUNNING to FAILED with failure cause:

Which will cause the exception of NoResourceAvailableException.

In https://dev.azure.com/apache-flink/apache-flink/_build/results?buildId=69874&view=logs&j=5c8e7682-d68f-54d1-16a2-a09310218a49&t=9d734c8c-6253-55e6-3bce-47e7cdf68ac4

It seems that the artificial error caused the TM exit?

I revisited the ci reports, there exist similar exceptions where an artificial error causes the TM exit when cleaning up the netty's buffer. However I have no idea how to fix that, maybe arvid could share some thoughts. Is it a good fix to suppress exception when `SpillingAdaptiveSpanningRecordDeserializer.clear`?

Let me take a look. The error is indeed intended but I currently don't know if the test or the exception handling is flaky. I'll take a quick tally on the last 5 failed tests in reverse order:

Failed variant:
[union with mixed channels, p = 10, timeout = 0]

[multi_input with mixed channels, p = 5, timeout = 0]

Oct 09 04:57:46

I suspect that some tasks take longer too clean up and thus not enough slots are available.

I'll double-check the test design. I suspect that I used the number of restarts to ensure certain behavior but that limits the robustness of the test as we may require more restarts in edge cases.

Thanks arvid! I noticed before the NoResourceAvailableException, one TM exit because: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLINK-38403?focusedCommentId=18023062&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-18023062 hope this helps.

hey guys, I analyzed one UnalignedCheckpointITCase.execute failure last week, the exception is also NoResourceAvailableException. And the root cause is taskmanager crashed by NPE. I could submit an PR to fix NPE as well.

Get more from this comment: https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/27095#issuecomment-3385826393

Merged a first fix with c7d683c9bf6118e06ac8c27674892ae19e0ad992.

The fix assumes that NoResourceAvailableException is temporary and a better test design with more retries will just help.

If NoResourceAvailableException is actually a different issue we will need another fix. But at this point, it's a bug that is (most likely) unrelated to unaligned checkpoints.

I'm still inclined to close the ticket for now and reopen if we have more cases on master. Note that I don't plan to backport because the flakiness is rather low and I have only seen instances on master. We can backport of course if we also hit it on other branches.
